availability.p: TEI material can be licensed differently depending on the use you intend to make of it. Hence it is made available under both the CC+BY and BSD-2 licences. The CC+BY licence is generally appropriate for usages which treat TEI content as data or documentation. The BSD-2 licence is generally appropriate for usage of TEI content in a software environment. For further information or clarification, please contact the TEI Consortium.

div.p: TEI-P5-based schema aims at helping with the encoding of single sheet legal documents as studied in the historial science of diplomatics. It is based upon the experience of the Charters Encoding Initiative..
For a start it includes the following modules of the TEI-P5 definition:
